data.title: Our Anniversary
data.text: This restaurant is amazing. The atmosphere is cosy and the wait staff knowledgeable about the dishes that are served. The Bleu cheese ice cream is divine. They are priced a bit high but for a special occasion it us definately worth it.

data.title: Superior Service and Superior Food !
data.text: This is the best food in all of Cheyenne bar none. I have been there a couple of times and highly recommend it.

data.title: Nice option in a steakhouse town
data.text: My husband and I decided to try the Morris House Bistro based on TripAdvisor reviews.  I am glad we did.  It was a nice option among all the steakhouse restaurants.  It is located in a cozy, old house with seating on the patio as well.  The atmosphere was pleasant.  I appreciated the menu options.  The only reason for the four stars was the vegetarian option on the menu focused on mushrooms (the only vegetable this vegetarian won't eat). I also wanted to try the tomato soup but it had chicken broth in it.  My loss.  The summer garden salad was delicious. My husband loved the shrimp and grits. The service was great (they were very busy that night).    I love places like this - off the beaten path with character.  I would definitely recommend MHB.

data.title: Lovely intimate dinner with a great, different menu
data.text:
We pulled up to a private house that had been elegantly converted to a restaurant of the highest standard, with air con.  There was also a covered terrace

Very good service, excellent menu and wind list.  We sat inside and had the goats cheese salad and spicy prawns to start.  The goats cheese was creamy and the prawns not too spicy 
We had duck with asparagus and catfish for mains, both beautifully presented,  cooked and very tasty. We shared a peanut butter crunch with a mango a strawberry sorbet, scrumptious!

The portions were not too large and we had a lovely evening

The bill for 2 was $120 including drinks and was worth every penny

data.title: Favorite place
data.text: This is my favorite place in town. We have enjoyed a large group special occasion dinner, a private date on the outdoor patio and a dinner with one other couple. The food has always been delicious. It is a little more expensive than average for Cheyenne but it is also a wonderful above average experience.

data.title: Roll the dice?
data.text: My wife and I have dined here several times. Our first time was absolutely excellent. With about four dinners there, we have found a wide swing in satisfaction. Many times they are out of house standards and specials. This usually a sign of management issues. For the price I have higher expectations. Sorry, but we're moving on.

data.title: Have dined here many times. Their seasonal menu is full of happy surprises.
data.text: This is a small restaurant with a nice patio. The food and cocktails taste great. The servers are down-to-earth and friendly, which fits wonderfully in our casual Western style. The restaurant is not Western though, it is low-country gourmet from Carolina.

data.title: Delicious food great service!
data.text: We stopped in during frontier days and had dinner. Delicious chicken wings and crab cakes, great wine selection. I had the Shrimp with grits and it was amazing. Son and his girlfriend had the big steak and veggie lasagna and both were just really tasty. The location in an antique home is eclectic but the A/C worked well on a hot July day and kept us nice and cool. I will go back every time for frontier days... Thank you for great service Ashley! Kudos to you and the whole staff-

data.title: Favorite Intimate Restaurant
data.text: This is my favorite place in town for a nice intimate dinner and also a nice night on the patio in the summer. The crab cakes are the best. Shrimp and Grits is my favorite they've had on their menu. Morris House is a do not miss in dining. The staff and owner are amazing. They treat you like family and are warm and welcoming.

data.title: Really good food!
data.text:
Ate there with family, and the food was really good.  Crab cakes, ribeye, grits, spinach/mushroom lasagna, catfish, and smoked pork loin were what we chose. 
Don't forget the bread pudding....👍.  Make sure to eat inside so you can get the fried bread!

data.title: Amazing dining experience in Cheyenne
data.text: Stopped in Cheyenne on a road trip from our home in Southern CA to Kansas City. Best restaurant in Cheyenne hands down. Situated in a historic house away from the melee from downtown, the ambiance is superb. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the 'Bacco wings, bruschetta and catfish. Accompanied with Black Tooth craft beers from Sheridan WY with Frank Sinatra playing in the background, you could not ask for a more unique dining experience. We finished off the meal with delicious bread pudding. Service was exemplary - Highly recommended!

data.title: Best Restaurant in Town!
data.text: I love that the menu is seasonally changing. The staff is very helpful and there are great food options for everyone!

data.title: The best and only real classy place in Cheyenne
data.text: Make a reservation. This place is adorably cute and the food is exquisite. It's pricy, but there is nothing remotely close to quality, atmosphere, and quality in the city. Lovely place! Great for dates!

data.title: Wyoming Cajun
data.text: Morris House is in a historic home in downtown Cheyenne.  The restaurant offers an intimate setting with a western Cajun flare.  The service is intimate also.  I prefer the Cajun rib eye but to honest there is nothing on the menu that is not great.  Enjoy!

data.title: Yummy food, friendly staff
data.text: Probably the best restaurant in Cheyenne. The food is classy southern but there are dishes for every taste. In a small historic home, make sure to get reservations. It's a bit expensive but perfect for special occasions. Don't miss the appetizers and desserts.

data.title: One of Cheyenne's best kept secrets
data.text:
Not many people know about the delightful food being served in Cheyenne.  Owners, Damion and Troy are always seeking out new variations on classic Cajun recipes to delight the taste buds of visitors to their historic restaurant.  Sometimes their preparations are subtle in flavor, others are bid and bold, but in neither case are the dishes ever bland or boring.  

The Morris House Bistro is small and not the most appropriate place to bring the kiddos; the atmosphere is more intimate and suited to the adult palate and conversation. That being said, during the summer lunch and dinner are served al fresco on the patio area, and there are specials for the kids.

data.title: Quaint but overpriced
data.text: Friendly staff and quaint atmosphere but too expensive for quality of food. Everything was overly salty and one side dish was too salty to eat but they didn't even offer to credit our bill. Menu offered unique dishes but lacked variety to choose from.

data.title: Best food in Cheyenne
data.text: Cheyenne is mainly a steak and beer kind of town, but everyone wants a white linen night once in a while without having to drive to Denver.  Morris House is our quirky gem.  Who would expect southern lowland cooking in a cow town?  While dishes can sometimes be on the rich, rich side of the butter plate Dameione appears to have lightened up a few dishes which I appreciate.  Keep it up Morris House!

data.title: Surprising South Carolina Cuisine in Cheyenne
data.text: I was surprised to find great South Carolina cuisine in Cheyenne.  Every course we had was a bit unique and very good.  We were there for brunch, and enjoyed the cocktails as well.  The service was very good.  Small restaurant, but you have to try it.

data.title: Phenomenal
data.text: This is one of those places many people do not know about but it is awesome. I believe it is a seasonal menu, so I cannot speak for the most recent menu but I have now been there twice and will likely go again this summer. This is definitely a date night type place, cozy setting and just a cool little bistro. Better to make a reservation, it is expensive but worth it!
